page.title: Human rights in Egypt under the Supreme Council of the Armed Forces

rev.diff:
Line 14: Line 14:
Five thousand six hundred civilians were tried in military tribunals in the last four months, according to HRW.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.almasryalyoum.com/en/node/465795 |title=Rights groups says Egypt still needs more change | Al-Masry Al-Youm: Today's News from Egypt |publisher=Al-Masry Al-Youm |date=1 June 2011 |accessdate=13 June 2011}}</ref> One of them is Amr El Beheiry.<ref name="Associated">{{cite web|last=Associated |first=The |url=http://wvgazette.com/ap/ApInternational/201105270558 |title=Egypt activists plan 'Second Revolution' - AP World News - The Charleston Gazette - West Virginia News and Sports |publisher=Wvgazette.com |date=27 May 2011 |accessdate=13 June 2011}}</ref> Beheiry was arrested during a violent military dispersal of a sit-in at the parliament on 26 February.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://articles.latimes.com/2011/may/27/world/la-fg-egypt-prisoners-20110527 |title=Egypt democracy protests: Egyptian activists plan protests over military trials - Los Angeles Times |publisher=Articles.latimes.com |date=27 May 2011 |accessdate=13 June 2011}}</ref> He was then referred to military court and after a swift trial without the presence of attorneys,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.almasryalyoum.com/en/node/451026 |title=Activists continue their battle against military trials as SCAF releases detainees | Al-Masry Al-Youm: Today's News from Egypt |publisher=Al-Masry Al-Youm |date=25 May 2011 |accessdate=13 June 2011}}</ref> where he received a sentence of five years on thuggery charges despite the testimonies of many eyewitnesses who said he broke no laws.<ref>{{cite web|author=Evan Hill |url=http://english.aljazeera.net/indepth/features/2011/05/2011519172611166398.html |title=Egypt's crackdown now wears camouflage - Features |publisher=Al Jazeera English |date=20 May 2011 |accessdate=13 June 2011}}</ref> Amnesty International also has called for Beheiry's release.<ref name="Associated"/><ref>{{cite news |title=Amnesty: Egypt still abusing human rights |first=Ben |last=Hubbard |url=http://www.google.com/hostednews/ap/article/ALeqM5ivQ098Va2atm7LVdxwta2mijygrg?docId=7f00d7e8d47a49c3976739edf72f5251 |publisher=Google.com |agency=[[Associated Press]] |date=18 May 2011 |accessdate=16 June 2011}}</ref>
Five thousand six hundred civilians were tried in military tribunals in the last four months, according to HRW.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.almasryalyoum.com/en/node/465795 |title=Rights groups says Egypt still needs more change | Al-Masry Al-Youm: Today's News from Egypt |publisher=Al-Masry Al-Youm |date=1 June 2011 |accessdate=13 June 2011}}</ref> One of them is Amr El Beheiry.<ref name="Associated">{{cite web|last=Associated |first=The |url=http://wvgazette.com/ap/ApInternational/201105270558 |title=Egypt activists plan 'Second Revolution' - AP World News - The Charleston Gazette - West Virginia News and Sports |publisher=Wvgazette.com |date=27 May 2011 |accessdate=13 June 2011}}</ref> Beheiry was arrested during a violent military dispersal of a sit-in at the parliament on 26 February.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://articles.latimes.com/2011/may/27/world/la-fg-egypt-prisoners-20110527 |title=Egypt democracy protests: Egyptian activists plan protests over military trials - Los Angeles Times |publisher=Articles.latimes.com |date=27 May 2011 |accessdate=13 June 2011}}</ref> He was then referred to military court and after a swift trial without the presence of attorneys,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.almasryalyoum.com/en/node/451026 |title=Activists continue their battle against military trials as SCAF releases detainees | Al-Masry Al-Youm: Today's News from Egypt |publisher=Al-Masry Al-Youm |date=25 May 2011 |accessdate=13 June 2011}}</ref> where he received a sentence of five years on thuggery charges despite the testimonies of many eyewitnesses who said he broke no laws.<ref>{{cite web|author=Evan Hill |url=http://english.aljazeera.net/indepth/features/2011/05/2011519172611166398.html |title=Egypt's crackdown now wears camouflage - Features |publisher=Al Jazeera English |date=20 May 2011 |accessdate=13 June 2011}}</ref> Amnesty International also has called for Beheiry's release.<ref name="Associated"/><ref>{{cite news |title=Amnesty: Egypt still abusing human rights |first=Ben |last=Hubbard |url=http://www.google.com/hostednews/ap/article/ALeqM5ivQ098Va2atm7LVdxwta2mijygrg?docId=7f00d7e8d47a49c3976739edf72f5251 |publisher=Google.com |agency=[[Associated Press]] |date=18 May 2011 |accessdate=16 June 2011}}</ref>
â   â
==Torture==
  â
[[File:Ramy Essam.jpg|thumb|Ramy Essam]]
  â
Ramy Essam, the 23-year-old Egyptian student and musician, was arrest and tortured by the army police on 9 March 2011.<ref name="CNN">{{cite web|author=By Â Reza Sayah, CNN |url=http://edition.cnn.com/2011/WORLD/meast/03/17/egypt.activists/index.html |title=Pro-democracy activists allege torture by Egyptian soldiers - CNN.com |publisher=Edition.cnn.com |date=18 March 2011 |accessdate=10 June 2011}}</ref> Without warning, the army stormed the [[Tahrir Square|square]], ripping down tents and arresting more than 100 people, including Ramy Essam.<ref name="NPR"/> He says men in army uniforms dragged him to the Egyptian National Museum, which had become a security headquarters.<ref name="NPR"/> He says the men took him to a courtyard, stripped him to his shorts, and started torturing Ramy Essam.<ref name="NPR"/> "They took off my clothes. They used sticks, metal rods, wires, whips." He received electric shocks, he said.<ref name="CNN"/> "There was a soldier who would jump in the air and land on my face with his legs".<ref name="CNN"/> Ramy Essam is best known as the singer of the Egyptian revolution due to his popular music during the Egyptian uprising against Hosni Mubarak.<ref name="NPR">{{cite web|url=http://www.npr.org/2011/03/15/134538629/ramy-esam-the-singer-of-the-egyptian-revolution |title=Ramy Essam: The Singer Of The Egyptian Revolution |publisher=NPR |date=15 March 2011 |accessdate=10 June 2011}}</ref>
  â   â
==Virginity testing==
  â
Since the overthrow of Mubarak there have been widespread reports of detained Egyptian women having their "virginity checked" by a male officer or doctor. Numerous journalists and released prisoners and protesters have confirmed the practice, which Egyptian officers said was to evaluate whether or not they had been raped.<ref>{{cite web|last=Leyne |first=Jon |url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-middle-east-13796966 |title=BBC News - Egypt's defiant women fear being cast aside |publisher=Bbc.co.uk |date= |accessdate=2011-06-20}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|author=June 2, 2011 |  9:32 am |url=http://latimesblogs.latimes.com/babylonbeyond/2011/06/egypt-victim-details-virginity-test-denies-military-claims.html |title=EGYPT: Woman denies military's claims about 'virginity test' - latimes.com |publisher=Latimesblogs.latimes.com |date=2011-06-02 |accessdate=2011-06-20}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2011/may/31/briefing-page-mideast/ |title=Briefly: Mideast |publisher=Washington Times |date=2011-05-31 |accessdate=2011-06-20}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.csmonitor.com/World/Backchannels/2011/0601/Virginity-tests-Misogyny-and-intimidation-in-Egypt |title=Virginity tests: Misogyny and intimidation in Egypt |publisher=CSMonitor.com |date=2011-06-01 |accessdate=2011-06-20}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NuR8gIYMEY8 |title=âªEgyptian army denies 'virginity tests'â¬â |publisher=YouTube |date=2011-06-01 |accessdate=2011-06-20}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.spiegel.de/international/world/0,1518,767365,00.html |title='Horribly Humiliating': Egyptian Woman Tells of 'Virginity Tests' - SPIEGEL ONLINE - News - International |publisher=Spiegel.de |date= |accessdate=2011-06-20}}</ref> The Egyptian military initially denied any virginity checks taking place<ref>{{cite web|url=http://english.aljazeera.net/video/middleeast/2011/06/20116255012877754.html |title=Egyptian army denies 'virginity tests' - Middle East |publisher=Al Jazeera English |date=2011-06-02 |accessdate=2011-06-20}}</ref> and then asserted the practice would not continue in the future.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://news.yahoo.com/s/afp/20110607/wl_africa_afp/egyptpoliticsunrestrights_20110607172638 |title=Egypt military rulers vow no more virginity tests: HRW - Yahoo! News |publisher=News.yahoo.com |date= |accessdate=2011-06-20}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|author=(AFP) – Jun 7, 2011 |url=http://www.google.com/hostednews/afp/article/ALeqM5h1oml-bY_PJl5W9cPJtbpdUY_y-Q?docId=CNG.fafcacea0287fbeab90256732f165e1e.3a1 |title=AFP: Egypt military rulers vow no more virginity tests: HRW |publisher=Google.com |date=2011-06-07 |accessdate=2011-06-20}}</ref> News of the virginity tests sparked a public outcry from [[Amnesty International]] and [[Human Rights Watch]] as well as local Egyptian activists and citizens in the country.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.cbsnews.com/8301-503543_162-20067419-503543.html |title=Report: Egypt admits to forcing "virginity tests" - World Watch |publisher=CBS News |date= |accessdate=2011-06-20}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.nzherald.co.nz/world/news/article.cfm?c_id=2&objectid=10729592 |title=Egyptian activists voice outrage at 'virginity tests' - World - NZ Herald News |publisher=Nzherald.co.nz |date= |accessdate=2011-06-20}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://blogs.cfr.org/coleman/2011/06/03/what-do-egyptians-say-about-the-militarys-virginity-testing/ |title=Isobel Coleman: Democracy in Development Â» Blog Archive Â» What Do Egyptians Say about the Militaryâs âVirginity Testingâ? |publisher=Blogs.cfr.org |date=2011-06-03 |accessdate=2011-06-20}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last=Mackey |first=Robert |url=http://thelede.blogs.nytimes.com/2011/06/01/egyptian-bloggers-press-army-on-abuses-during-interim-rule/ |title=Egyptian Bloggers Press Army on Abuses During Interim Rule - NYTimes.com |location=Egypt |publisher=Thelede.blogs.nytimes.com |date=2011-06-01 |accessdate=2011-06-20}}</ref> Protesters have seen the tests as evidence that more reform is needed and that the rule under SCAF is not stable or trustworthy.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.almasryalyoum.com/en/node/465795 |title=Rights groups says Egypt still needs more change | Al-Masry Al-Youm: Today's News from Egypt |publisher=Al-Masry Al-Youm |date=2011-06-01 |accessdate=2011-06-20}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.thenational.ae/news/worldwide/middle-east/disillusion-starts-to-grow-with-egypts-military-amid-fears-of-mini-mubaraks |title=Disillusion starts to grow with Egypt's military amid fears of 'mini-Mubaraks - The National |publisher=Thenational.ae |date= |accessdate=2011-06-20}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.almasryalyoum.com/en/node/466660 |title=Human Rights Watch: The Egyptian revolution is not over | Al-Masry Al-Youm: Today's News from Egypt |publisher=Al-Masry Al-Youm |date=2010-01-24 |accessdate=2011-06-20}}</ref>
 
==Censorship==
==Censorship==
Line 32: Line 25:
Egyptian blogger and activist [[Rasha Azab]] and [[El Fagr]] newspaper Editor in Chief [[Adel Hammouda]] have been summoned by military prosecution. They are to appear before military prosecutors on 19 June 2011.<ref name="ahram1">{{cite web|url=http://english.ahram.org.eg/News/14532.aspx |title=Journalists Rasha Azab and Adel Hammouda summoned by Egypt's military prosecution - Politics - Egypt - Ahram Online |publisher=English.ahram.org.eg |date= |accessdate=2011-06-18}}</ref> Azab published an article in El Fagr newspaper detailing the meeting that took place between members of the Supreme Council of the Armed Forces (SCAF) and the No to Military Trials campaigners.<ref name="ahram1"/>
Egyptian blogger and activist [[Rasha Azab]] and [[El Fagr]] newspaper Editor in Chief [[Adel Hammouda]] have been summoned by military prosecution. They are to appear before military prosecutors on 19 June 2011.<ref name="ahram1">{{cite web|url=http://english.ahram.org.eg/News/14532.aspx |title=Journalists Rasha Azab and Adel Hammouda summoned by Egypt's military prosecution - Politics - Egypt - Ahram Online |publisher=English.ahram.org.eg |date= |accessdate=2011-06-18}}</ref> Azab published an article in El Fagr newspaper detailing the meeting that took place between members of the Supreme Council of the Armed Forces (SCAF) and the No to Military Trials campaigners.<ref name="ahram1"/>
  +   +
==Torture==
  +
[[File:Ramy Essam.jpg|thumb|Ramy Essam]]
  +
Ramy Essam, the 23-year-old Egyptian student and musician, was arrest and tortured by the army police on 9 March 2011.<ref name="CNN">{{cite web|author=By Â Reza Sayah, CNN |url=http://edition.cnn.com/2011/WORLD/meast/03/17/egypt.activists/index.html |title=Pro-democracy activists allege torture by Egyptian soldiers - CNN.com |publisher=Edition.cnn.com |date=18 March 2011 |accessdate=10 June 2011}}</ref> Without warning, the army stormed the [[Tahrir Square|square]], ripping down tents and arresting more than 100 people, including Ramy Essam.<ref name="NPR"/> He says men in army uniforms dragged him to the Egyptian National Museum, which had become a security headquarters.<ref name="NPR"/> He says the men took him to a courtyard, stripped him to his shorts, and started torturing Ramy Essam.<ref name="NPR"/> "They took off my clothes. They used sticks, metal rods, wires, whips." He received electric shocks, he said.<ref name="CNN"/> "There was a soldier who would jump in the air and land on my face with his legs".<ref name="CNN"/> Ramy Essam is best known as the singer of the Egyptian revolution due to his popular music during the Egyptian uprising against Hosni Mubarak.<ref name="NPR">{{cite web|url=http://www.npr.org/2011/03/15/134538629/ramy-esam-the-singer-of-the-egyptian-revolution |title=Ramy Essam: The Singer Of The Egyptian Revolution |publisher=NPR |date=15 March 2011 |accessdate=10 June 2011}}</ref>
  +   +
==Virginity testing==
  +
Since the overthrow of Mubarak there have been widespread reports of detained Egyptian women having their "virginity checked" by a male officer or doctor. Numerous journalists and released prisoners and protesters have confirmed the practice, which Egyptian officers said was to evaluate whether or not they had been raped.<ref>{{cite web|last=Leyne |first=Jon |url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-middle-east-13796966 |title=BBC News - Egypt's defiant women fear being cast aside |publisher=Bbc.co.uk |date= |accessdate=2011-06-20}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|author=June 2, 2011 |  9:32 am |url=http://latimesblogs.latimes.com/babylonbeyond/2011/06/egypt-victim-details-virginity-test-denies-military-claims.html |title=EGYPT: Woman denies military's claims about 'virginity test' - latimes.com |publisher=Latimesblogs.latimes.com |date=2011-06-02 |accessdate=2011-06-20}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2011/may/31/briefing-page-mideast/ |title=Briefly: Mideast |publisher=Washington Times |date=2011-05-31 |accessdate=2011-06-20}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.csmonitor.com/World/Backchannels/2011/0601/Virginity-tests-Misogyny-and-intimidation-in-Egypt |title=Virginity tests: Misogyny and intimidation in Egypt |publisher=CSMonitor.com |date=2011-06-01 |accessdate=2011-06-20}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NuR8gIYMEY8 |title=âªEgyptian army denies 'virginity tests'â¬â |publisher=YouTube |date=2011-06-01 |accessdate=2011-06-20}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.spiegel.de/international/world/0,1518,767365,00.html |title='Horribly Humiliating': Egyptian Woman Tells of 'Virginity Tests' - News |publisher=News.yahoo.com |date= |accessdate=2011-06-20}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|author=(AFP) – Jun 7, 2011 |url=http://www.google.com/hostednews/afp/article/ALeqM5h1oml-bY_PJl5W9cPJtbpdUY_y-Q?docId=CNG.fafcacea0287fbeab90256732f165e1e.3a1 |title=AFP: Egypt military rulers vow no more virginity tests: HRW |publisher=Google.com |date=2011-06-07 |accessdate=2011-06-20}}</ref> News of the virginity tests sparked a public outcry from [[Amnesty International]] and [[Human Rights Watch]] as well as local Egyptian activists and citizens in the country.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.cbsnews.com/8301-503543_162-20067419-503543.html |title=Report: Egypt admits to forcing "virginity tests" - World Watch |publisher=CBS News |date= |accessdate=2011-06-20}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.nzherald.co.nz/world/news/article.cfm?c_id=2&objectid=10729592 |title=Egyptian activists voice outrage at 'virginity tests' - World - NZ Herald News |publisher=Nzherald.co.nz |date= |accessdate=2011-06-20}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://blogs.cfr.org/coleman/2011/06/03/what-do-egyptians-say-about-the-militarys-virginity-testing/ |title=Isobel Coleman: Democracy in Development Â» Blog Archive Â» What Do Egyptians Say about the Militaryâs âVirginity Testingâ? |publisher=Blogs.cfr.org |date=2011-06-03 |accessdate=2011-06-20}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last=Mackey |first=Robert |url=http://thelede.blogs.nytimes.com/2011/06/01/egyptian-bloggers-press-army-on-abuses-during-interim-rule/ |title=Egyptian Bloggers Press Army on Abuses During Interim Rule - NYTimes.com |location=Egypt |publisher=Thelede.blogs.nytimes.com |date=2011-06-01 |accessdate=2011-06-20}}</ref> Protesters have seen the tests as evidence that more reform is needed and that the rule under SCAF is not stable or trustworthy.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.almasryalyoum.com/en/node/465795 |title=Rights groups says Egypt still needs more change | Al-Masry Al-Youm: Today's News from Egypt |publisher=Al-Masry Al-Youm |date=2011-06-01 |accessdate=2011-06-20}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.thenational.ae/news/worldwide/middle-east/disillusion-starts-to-grow-with-egypts-military-amid-fears-of-mini-mubaraks |title=Disillusion starts to grow with Egypt's military amid fears of 'mini-Mubaraks - The National |publisher=Thenational.ae |date= |accessdate=2011-06-20}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.almasryalyoum.com/en/node/466660 |title=Human Rights Watch: The Egyptian revolution is not over | Al-Masry Al-Youm: Today's News from Egypt |publisher=Al-Masry Al-Youm |date=2010-01-24 |accessdate=2011-06-20}}</ref>
